intro: Cincinnobotrys burttianus, commonly known as the Burtt's cincinnobothrys, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a peppery scent when crushed. Cincinnobotrys burttianus is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
